replies.msg: 我國版蘇斯克查

VECINO: "THE CHAMPIONS LEAGUE IS IN MY DESTINY..."

The Uruguayan midfielder, scorer of the decisive goal against Tottenham: "We believed in ourselves until the end, we always have to show this belief"

Once again a winning header, once again in the final few minutes, once again the match-winner. Matias Vecino had this to say following Inter’s 2-1 victory against Tottenham: "We believed we could get a result right until the very end - also thanks to the incredible support we received from San Siro. After we equalised we went looking for the winner, this attitude is a sign of our mentality: after this victory we hope we can turn things around following a difficult start. Tomorrow we have to continue to work with the same belief we displayed today. Is the Champions League in my destiny? In Rome against Lazio and today I experienced great emotions, I hope this will continue."

quote.msg: 一唔睇就贏 我都想睇到反cup呀，點解要咁對我

ICARDI: "A SPECTACULAR EVENING"

A debut goal for Mauro Icardi in the Champions League: "The important thing is that Inter keep winning"

As is tradition, Mauro Icardi scored a debut goal in the Champions League on Tuesday: “I came into that position and the ball was then played to Asamoah. I noticed that all of their players had dropped into the area so I remained outside. He then did well to spot me and play in a fantastic ball before I then couldn’t not shoot and it went well.

“It was a spectacular evening and it was what we had to do. We know that we have a strong squad, one that can play against anyone. Looking beyond our start to the season, we know our qualities and it this was exactly what we needed. After waiting for three months, we came into this match and achieved our goal. Obviously, it gives us a lot of strength and it will give us something more to now do well in the league.

“This win is key because it gives us confidence. As I said before, we know our qualities in a match like this. Also, in the Champions League, the right atmosphere gives you the will to keep working. You can’t let a win go, the group is long and you can’t progress without winning. I think that we should remain calm and happy because no one imagined a game like this. We should take the positives from this performance. I don’t know if it’s a turning point as the Coach said, however, obviously we go into Saturday with a different mentality. A win like this gives you a lot of confidence to keep going.

“Vecino has done that twice now and it's brought us two wins. However, the important thing is Inter winning, beyond me, Vecino or anyone else scoring. The important thing is that Inter keep winning.”

史堅後期打得差我覺得係因為早早就食咗張冤枉嘅黃牌， 嗰下完全食咗son 身位， 係因為佢大隻啲所以睇落son好似中咗槍咁。 攞咗張黃牌之後佢就畏首畏尾咁。。
總括成埸波嚟講， 我哋前場打得唔好， 我覺得唔係因為實力差距， 係因為我哋好多球員都未有過歐聯經驗， 怯場， 去到final third大家都打得好急， 我覺得呢個問題會隨著場數而去而有所改善。 最重要我哋仍然係嗰支唔會放棄嘅球隊。 呢個係我哋嘅足球遺產， 係改變唔到嘅， 而相信亦都係呢對球隊吸引到我哋嘅原因。

JOAO MARIO: "I WANT TO TURN THE WHISTLES INTO APPLAUSE"

The Portuguese midfielder today spoke to Sky: "I am training well and I want to make sure I'm ready to give my best when called upon"

Following this morning's training session at Appiano Gentile, Joao Mario conducted this interview with Sky Sport: "I am calm. I am working well and I am available to Coach Spalletti. I am waiting for an opportunity to help the team. I am still here, and I know the coach, players and the club. There are no problems and the most important thing for me now is to get back to my best so I can help the team."

The Portuguese midfielder also discussed the controversy surrounding an interview he released some time ago: "When I discussed the problems of my Inter experience, I was misinterpreted by the person who interviewed me. My first year at Inter wasn't easy. It was my first outside of Portugal and the team changed a lot that season. However, that is now part of the past and I am only thinking about turning whistles into applause. I know that my body language can sometimes be read badly and this is something that I am working on.

"When I chose to leave last winter it was only because I didn't want to risk missing out on the World Cup. It wasn't because of any issues with the coach or my teammates. I am now more mature compared to when I arrived. I've had a great relationship with the squad since day one, in particular with Miranda, D'Ambrosio, Handanovic and Perisic. They all helped me a lot when I joined the club. I am training well and I want to make sure I can give best when called upon."

Following this morning's training session at Appiano Gentile, Joao Mario conducted this interview with Sky Sport: "I am calm. I am working well and I am available to Coach Spalletti. I am waiting for an opportunity to help the team. I am still here, and I know the coach, players and the club. There are no problems and the most important thing for me now is to get back to my best so I can help the team."

The Portuguese midfielder also discussed the controversy surrounding an interview he released some time ago: "When I discussed the problems of my Inter experience, I was misinterpreted by the person who interviewed me. My first year at Inter wasn't easy. It was my first outside of Portugal and the team changed a lot that season. However, that is now part of the past and I am only thinking about turning whistles into applause. I know that my body language can sometimes be read badly and this is something that I am working on.

"When I chose to leave last winter it was only because I didn't want to risk missing out on the World Cup. It wasn't because of any issues with the coach or my teammates. I am now more mature compared to when I arrived. I've had a great relationship with the squad since day one, in particular with Miranda, D'Ambrosio, Handanovic and Perisic. They all helped me a lot when I joined the club. I am training well and I want to make sure I can give best when called upon."
而家冇得出踢先黎道歉

Inter want to sign Lyon midfielder Lucas Tousart, Calciomercato.com’s Fabrizio Romano can exclusively reveal.

The French midfielder is one of the most promising footballers in Europe and Tottenham are also linked with welcoming his services although Lyon’s asking price is in the region of € 35 million.

Inter will send some of their scouts to watch Tousart in action in the coming weeks. The Nerazzurri want a center midfielder with his qualities to complete their squad in the middle of the park.

Inter could make an offer in January or at the end of the season with Tousart, 21, that remains one of the key targets of the Serie A giants who need a man confident with playing in front of defense in a 4-2-3-1 system.

Tousart is regarded as one of the most exciting prospects in Europe and Inter will be monitoring him in the coming weeks, ready to submit an official offer whenever they will have a chance. Meantime talks with the player’s entourage are ongoing

Following Tuesday’s win over Fiorentina, Radja Nainggolan today released an interview with Sky Sport, discussing his first few months as a Nerazzurri player: “I am giving my all during this new adventure. Obviously, I still have to improve considering I missed out on preparations and I will show that little bit extra to reach the top. However, I am not worried. I felt at ease here at Inter straight away. I was welcomed into the club with open arms. I am happy to be here and I hope it’s a successful period. Our main aim this year is to improve on last season. We didn’t start in the best manner, but our last two wins have put us back on track. We hope to now continue like this. The road is long, but we’ve won two important games and we must keep moving forward in the same fashion. There are plenty of expectations on us but we’ve demonstrated that we can win tough matches. We are a strong side.”

On a personal level, the Ninja is still motivated and determined as ever: “I want to win trophies, that is obvious. I’ve always given my all out on the pitch but it’s now the right time to win something. However, we’ll keep our heads down. It’s better to say nothing and then see where we are at the end of the season. My bow against Bologna? It just came out in the moment. I wanted to present myself to the fans considering that I had missed the first two games. I am always happy when I score, but the important thing is that the team keep winning. Being a symbol of this Inter team? I think about playing and doing well out on the pitch – that is what interests me most. I have found a lot of enthusiasm here in Milan - particularly due to being back in the Champions League. It’s amazing to play at a packed San Siro. We’ll give our all to win every match and we all hope to secure results together as a team.”

The Belgian has also met back up with Luciano Spalletti at Inter, having previously worked with him at Roma: “I work very well with him and we’ve picked up some important results together. I hope to enjoy much more here at Inter. He really wanted to bring me here and I am pleased to have joined the club. I am now focused on giving my all. Totti? To play with someone like him was one of the greatest moments of my career. We have a great relationship and I am always in contact with him.”

Former Roma manager Rudi Garcia has revealed he was aware that the Giallorossi were working behind his back and holding talks with other managers during his tenure in charge at the club.

“At the end of the season season, after the derby which confirmed we’d finish second, I said what I thought about the gap to Juventus and the impossibility of winning the Scudetto,” he told Corriere dello Sport.

“At that point it was over, my card was marked. Di Francesco said the same thing two weeks ago, in France we have a proverb which states that it’s not good to be right too early.

“I don’t know who decided my fate and I don’t care. I only know that contacts with my successor Luciano Spalletti had been ongoing for some time, there wasn’t much respect for me. I was a dead man walking from the start of the season, and I got things wrong too.”

Lautaro Martinez is “very happy with the choice he made” to join Inter among many other offers, said his father, and can play alongside Mauro Icardi.

The 21-year-old was snapped up from Racing Club for €16m in July, fighting off competition from the likes of Real Madrid, Borussia Dortmund and Atletico Madrid.

“He is very happy in Milan as a city and at Inter as a club,” his father Mario Martinez told FCInter1908.it.

“The Nerazzurri gave him a marvellous welcome and he is settling in quickly. It’s true that he had many offers, but Inter seemed most suited to him. Everyone dreams of playing in Serie A, plus they had qualified for the Champions League.

“There were many factors that pushed him towards accepting Inter and he is very happy with the choice he made. Right now his next target is to win the Milan Derby and then score his first Champions League goal.”

Lautaro has already scored his first goal for Inter in Serie A and for Argentina at senior level.

“It’s an incredible time for him, something he always dreamed of, especially to score his first in Serie A at San Siro.”

He is seen as an alternative to Mauro Icardi at both club and international level, but can they play together?

“He has a very good rapport with Mauro, both on and off the field, as Icardi helped so much in the process of settling in. They can happily play together, and did so in several summer friendlies.”

With the Milan derby approaching, Inter's Radja Nainggolan is getting ready to bring his passion on the pitch for the first time against Milan in a Nerazzurri shirt. The Belgian midifielder adressed the big match but also his departure from Roma in an interview with La Gazzetta dello Sport: "I told a friend of mine that I'm ok with losing both the derby games as long as at hte end of the season we are in the Champions League and they aren't. Milan are a strong side, they will be a tough opponent for us. Higuain? He is very good, he can play with his teammates also outside the box, but I would keep Icardi all day long. He can score even if he is given half a chance"

"Spalletti? There was this one time when he asked me to sleep at Trigoria for four or five nights because he wanted to work with me. Playing as a trequartista? He doesn't say that, because he is afraid that I don't track back if I think I am a trequartista. He called it an 'extra midfielder'. Roma? I didn't feel like they respected me. I made many mistakes, but they held negotiations with foreign clubs without saying anything to me. It was like they didn't care much about me. I didn't want to go to those clubs and that was when Spalletti called me. I didn't have to think twice. Here the managent are more close to the team, Steven Zhang is here in Appiano all the time. When I was at Roma Pallotta showed up only once or twice a year. Isn't the boss supposed to follow his business closely?".

Nainggolan also revealed why he doesn't like Juventus that much and a player that could follow in his footprints: "Juventus? They did something to you once, and then again and again. Eventually you grow to dislike them. They wanted to sign me for 4-5 years but I always turned them down. Barella? I can see myself in him, have you seen how he played for Italy?"

9斬華願意離隊 望重返國家隊

據《拖連奴體育報》報導，9斬華願意離開國米前往拖連奴，他相信自己可以重返國家隊。這位中場球員今季表現不佳，有報導稱拖連奴將在明年冬窗租借他。

《拖連奴體育報》表示，9斬華對轉會持開放態度，他認為馬沙利的4-3-3陣型很適合自己。此外，9斬華也相信，轉會至拖連奴有助於自己重返國家隊。
